info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 25 at 1:28AM EDT until August 25 at 2:15AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HARRISON...NORTHERN JEFFERSON...SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA...EASTERN CARROLL...BEAVER...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON... SOUTHEASTERN LAWRENCE...SOUTHWESTERN BUTLER...NORTHWESTERN ALLEGHENY...BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES... At 128 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Zelienople to near Chester to 9 miles southeast of Carrollton, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Ross Township, McCandless Township, Cranberry, Moon Township, Weirton, Steubenville, Franklin Park, East Liverpool, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, Monaca, Wellsville, Carrollton, Hampton Township, Robinson Township, Economy, Ellwood City, Ambridge, Wexford, and New Brighton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
